Don't buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon S630
Reviews.Author: Matthew Brien
Reviews.Content: Far exceeds expectations -- clear pictures, no fuss.  Automatic features very easy to use.  Very reasonible price.  Quick turn-on.

Reviews.Title: Very Poor Image quality - my old 5 mp did a better job.
Reviews.Author: William F. Van Stone Jr.
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after owning a Canon S50 (5 mega pix). The Nikon S630's build quality is ok, The size is good, the 7x zoom is nice but it's all a waste of money because the image quality is so bad. I ended up returning it and bought a Panasonic LX3.More Mega pixels is not the answer, the photos from my old canon S50 were very very sharp when you zoomed in on the image. When I say zoomed in I mean when viewing them on a computer. Because of this sharpness you can zoom in and crop the photo and have very goods results.  When I tried to do this with the Nikon S630 the pictures were blurry. I tried several settings along with using a tripod (with VR shut off) with no luck. This camera just had very poor image quality.

Reviews.Title: nice only most of the time
Reviews.Author: Meester Shack "ShackMon"
Reviews.Content: I don't know what I do wrong, but I do 'it' too often.  I get people snapshots slightly out of focus. I have it on auto, people are not in 'action', the photos just don't come out sharp... and others come out perfectly.  This is my 3rd (unless you count about 5 coolpix 7900s, which were great and I'd buy now if they were still selling them).  Also the battery/sdcard door comes open fairly easily and I expect I'll snap it off by accident someday.  It has disappointed me too many times and I'm trying a Canon.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: David C. Eccleston "Dave Eccleston"
Reviews.Content: Clean interface, lots of features.  Fits in your pocket.  I like how the shutter closes automatically, it keeps the lens from getting dirty/scratched.  I especially like the panorama and close up modes, as I was backpacking for 3 days and taking a lot of nature shots.  The battery lasted until the end of the trip, and I took over 300 pictures.The wheel interface is nice, it makes it really easy to change modes and navigate menus.  You can click up on the wheel and adjust the flash setting (auto, on, off), or click left on the wheel to adjust timer settings.  On my previous camera it was hard to find these settings so I just never used them.The one problem is that the wide/zoom control is a little sensitive.  It's easy to zoom in too close or out too far, and you sometimes have to iterate to get it exactly where you want.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: BDP "average guy"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera, primarily for the 7x optical zoom, but was pleasantly surprised at the ease of use and quality of the pictures.  We previously had a 5 year old Olympus and were not looking for 12MG pixel camera.  This fit our needs exactly.  The screen is bright and the control menus are somewhat intuitive.  The camera does have many features so there are several layers to the menus.  The initial delay for the first shot is acceptable.I would recommend this camera to anyone who wants a little more than a basic camera, with a good zoom and the option to make some adjustments through the menu system.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA, GREAT PRICE
Reviews.Author: Charles S. Pickard "stereo buff"
Reviews.Content: Positive:The camera provides excellent features, 12 mpxls, and a fast shudder release.  Easy to use and light to carry.Negative:Battery life is mediocre and I recommend a back up battery.  The software for downloading, editing, etc. on a computer is fair.  You need a better software program.  HP has an excellent program, but it appears to be incompatible with Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Shannon S. Ybarra
Reviews.Content: So far I have had a great experience with taking pictures.  I especially like that when I am taking a picture in a dark room or at night, the picture comes out perfect when the flash is on.  My sister has a coolpix and I have borrowed hers many times, so i knew when i was going to purchase a digital camera I was definitely going to buy a coolpix.  I have been with out a digital camera for 3years due to my Kodak not keeping the battery life.  I will never purchase a Kodak again, It will be Nikon all the way.

Reviews.Title: Not the quality you would expect from Nikon
Reviews.Author: T. Parker
Reviews.Content: I have a Kodak that is a few years old and thought it was time to upgrade.  I went to several stores and checked the camera out.  You cannot tell the picture quality until you download them. I was swayed in my decision because the sales associate said the Nikon was the most durable. I carefully read reviews from many sources.  I thought I would take a chance on this camera because there were people who said to change the factory settings for a better picture quality.  Well I did just that and the picture quality is terrible.  I have a Kodak Easy Share 6.1 MP and it takes a much better picture.  I am so sorry I purchased this camera.  If I was given another chance I would buy a Kodak.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: NotaMacGenius "Martin"
Reviews.Content: I like this camera overall - except in very bright sunlight when you cannot be sure of the image.The only real downside is the battery -- it goes dead with no warning. So, beware, and buy an extra battery.There should be some kind of battery life indicator, but I have yet to find it.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix S630
Reviews.Author: D. Davis
Reviews.Content: After looking at most of the cameras that fit the needs of my wife, I chose the Nikon - S630  COOLPIX.  I read dozens of reviews - some good and some not so good. I think that the poor reviews were mostly from people who had too high expectation of this little NIKON.  Well here is mind review. The camera is small and the controls are well thought out.The camera fits easily  in a pocket or purse.  One of the best features is the 7X zoom lens, that works great. I took a picture of a wall and window to a restaurant in the City Centre, Las Wages and then zoomed in thru the window to see a chef making Japanese Sushi,  awesome pics.  The camera is fast and the quality of the pictures is almost as good as my expensive DSLR. The only thing is does not take pictures while swinging the camera around, but who does that?  The camera worked well in dark situations on AUTO. and also with the flash turned off. I shot sunsets and scenes in the desert with good quality. Inside shots were better than I thought they would be. The old camera was a Canon and it took great pics too, but the S630 Coolpic was even better to my surprise.  Another great feature is the lens is out in a second or less ready to shoot, so you don't miss a shot. We got about 200 shots per charge on the rechargeable battery and used a 4 GB memory chip which gave over 1250 pictures at the highest quality. I have yet to use the movie feature and some of the other manual features. The camera can even tell when a person smiles or blinks - amazing.  If you are looking for a compact camera and very good quality, this Coolpic S630 fit the bill for me.  Now my wife want her Christmas present back, so she can shoot some pics and she did and her pictures came out great too. She liked the Zoom right by the release button. the 2.7 inch view is plenty big too! Happy hunting for a camera at $200 with a case and memory chip  too. :)

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot, Minor Inconveniences
Reviews.Author: MW
Reviews.Content: The camera actually feels pretty solid in my hands, you can tell it's plastic but it doesn't feel cheap overall. The pictures I took came out great, everything was clear even on most of the 7x zoom shots (more zoom = you need to move less). I am very happy with the quality of the lens and the layout. Nikon really gave it some extras such as using a zoom ring and a comfortable thumb rest while shooting (portrait and landscape modes). I am pleased with the shooting response time (from powering on to taking a picture) and have not experienced any shutter lag (I know that it IS slower than others, but really if you're getting a small point and shoot you have to give up something when the camera is $225.) I did play around with some of the features such as messing with the AUTO settings and the automatic smile mode. I didn't find the auto smile mode (it shoots when it senses a smile) to be that worthwhile. There are a lot of scene modes which can be overwhelming, but the auto scene selector works great! I have not done enough testing to see how the color really turns out under different settings.I gave this 4 stars and not a full 5 for a few reasons that are more personal annoyances than performance issues. The first is that the little dial on the back feels cheap. I would have rather this been metal. It doesn't affect performance, but it does take away from the experience when you feel it. The second problem is that the menu is terrible. Nikon needs to put some R&D; into making a menu that is very intuitive and user friendly. A nice GUI would really go a long way - this looks like a theme from DOS when you perform certain actions (such as format the card). Another thing is while looking at the thumbnails it is a pain to zoom back out. There is no quick way to get back to the picture in original size. Instead you have to zoom out .2x each time. Yow can hold it down, but then it goes to the view where you can see multiple thumbnails on the screen. A .5 or 1 second delay would help this out. The smallest complaint is that the charger does not have a flip out plug, you have to take the charging unit AND the (long) cord with you when you travel.All in all these are tiny complaints for such a great camera. I recommend getting a case and screen protector for it and of course a large SDHC card and extra battery (from experience). Really this is a great camera for a little over $220 (at the time of this review). As with anything make sure you do research and try to get a hands on demo before buying it.

Reviews.Title: Frustrated by photo quality
Reviews.Author: Busy NY Mom
Reviews.Content: Although in theory this camera comes with some great features, I am very disappointed. I had a Coolpix 4800 for several years, and despite the fact that it boasted only 4 MP, i feel that the photos were far superior to the ones i am getting out of the s630. I was excited to find another nikon with a lot of zoom, and expected the same quality as what i had previously. Unfortunatly, i was dissapointed.Outdoors the colors are great and crisp, but i have yet to shoot an indoor shot that makes me really happy. as a mom taking pics of her kids all the time, this is frustrating beyond words. the colors take on an unnatural reddish orangey hue, and i constantly get blurring, even with image stabilization. I have tried Auto mode and scene selecter and every type of scene possible, but no matter what i do, the color quality is just off and fuzziness common. After several months i finally figured out that the best way to get my kids and not worry about them moving and therefore blurring or getting that ghostly motions quality, as they invariably do, is to use sports mode, but then the camera drops to 3MP. As a result the photos are not really crisp, which when buying a camera with as many MP as this one has regularly, it's once again, frustrating. On the plus side, I have the red one, which is really fun looking, and i love the size and the zoom is pretty close to my old 4800 (which drowned last summer :-( and is no longer working). Also, it's really comfortable in a hand of my size and has a nice thumbgrip intentation.**Update: After writing this review i realized how truly annoyed i am about my photos, so i actually contacted Nikon through their website and attached two of my photos as examples of their poor quality.  They actually told me what to change in my setting to hopefully fix the problem.  I shot a few pictures which actually seem much better, but it's too soon to tell.  I will be taking lots of pictures in the days to come and if i see a difference, i will come back, change the rating and let you know how to adjust the menu for better pics!*****update 12/29/10 while nikon was very helpful in terms of customer service, the photos are still not as good as they should be. THe colors are still not true to life and i still get considerable blurring, perhaps not as much as previously, but still a lot.***

Reviews.Title: Researcher of Products
Reviews.Author: Karan L. Paulson "Perfectionist"
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this camera after returning the Fuji FinePix waterproof camera $129.00.This camera is just fantastic.  The speed of taking pictures is incredible (no waiting between shots).I have an expensive high end Oympus and wanted a small camera to take quick shots.  This camera is just the answer.I can snap clear/perfect shots at a moments notice while on the move and never again miss a shot while the camera is focasing as I did with my high end camera.I had considered the Cannon ELF 12MP and the Sony Cyber Shot 12MM, both great cameras, but am glad I decided on the Nikon CoolPix 12MP.  This camera was recommended by a professional photographer friend of mine.My friend also recommended a well padded case.  This is for 2 reasons, first so the lens does not get knocked out of alignment while in a pocket, purse, or belt and second, a well padded case will gradually absorb any humidity/moisture and keep the camera dry.

Reviews.Title: This is a great compact point and shoot.
Reviews.Author: M. Hall "Engineer/Ski Bum"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace a hp with 6x optical zoom and am sure happy with my purchase.  I've now taken about 1000 pictures and a dozen movie clips in a variety of conditions.  The optical vibration reduction works great, I've taken lots pictures while skiing and at Disney parks on rides and they come out great during daylight hours.  It's really fast (I use a class 6 Transend memory card) between pictures.  It does take a couple seconds to recharge the flash when the battery is lower.  I read complaints of bad pixels, which I see many of when veiwing pics on the camera, but they don't appear when I upload the photos or print them out.  I also tested a few at stores and some previews looked really red toned  This was also the case with my purchase but the pics appear fine once uploaded.  The auto setting works great except for outdoor night shots.  To shoot in low light the exposure gets long and the camera must be set against somthing steady like a wall.  The videos are really clear but the sound is a little weak.  The controls take a little getting used to but work great almost as well as my HP.  I love the 7x zoom, start up and pic to pic speed.  I've never seen a point and shoot that works this well and after a lot of use I am thrilled about it.  My only dilemma was Amazons shipping, it took 15 days to arrive, I should of ordered it through a different supplier.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA!!!
Reviews.Author: M. C. Smith
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE my Nikon Coolpix!!! The pictures are beautiful. I'm not quite sure what the people that have bad pictures coming out are doing with their camera, but my pictures are great! AND the video is wonderful! I am having so much fun with it. I was able to take great videos of my kids during their snow day from school. It only takes a couple of seconds transfer everything from the SD card to the computer. I would recommend this to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: Love the Nikon Coolpix S630
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a replacement camera for an earlier model Coolpix I had for several years and then broke. I was very happy with the earlier model, but this one has more bells and whistles and has a much better zoom. It also has a metal case, unlike the last version's plastic shell. I use it primarily for still shots, but it does have a video function, and is great to take when travelling and you don't want to haul a camcorder around too. It uses an SD memory card, available with up to 2 gigs of memory- plenty for storing hundreds of photos or several short videos. The rechargable battery is the square EN-EL12 type. Nikon claims you can get 200 shots before needing a recharge but I've found it to be a little less than that. Get a spare. Nikon has somewhat simplified the menu access on the Coolpix from earlier models. It's easy to move through the menu tabs and select the item you want. Downloading photos is easy. It comes with software, but I don't use it- just dump it right to my hard drive with the included mini usb cord. I'm very happy with overall camera and image quality. The only drawback is the recharge time it takes between shots.

Reviews.Title: Versatile Little Camera - Great Photos
Reviews.Author: Evergreen
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera so that I wouldn't have to carry my Nikon DSLR on a European holiday.  The 7x zoom in a small package sold me on this particular model.  While it has many scene settings, I kept it on Auto most of the time, and most shots were perfect.  I was continually pleased with the exposures.  I took a lot of indoor shots in museums without a flash and almost all were keepers.  The only complaint I have is a big one.  The zoom lacks fine control and I was frequently unable to frame a picture the way I wanted it.  The zoomed shots were clear, however.  In spite of the zoom issue I am very happy with photo quality and ease of use.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S630 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Jean M. Davis
Reviews.Content: Still learning to use this camera, as I've had it only a month, but it appears to be easy to use. Love the macro setting. The "door" covering the cord attachment spot for uploading to the computer is a funny little creation. It sometimes takes awhile to get the door out of the way so I can attach the cord in its proper place on the camera. Other than that, everything seems well designed and user-friendly.

Reviews.Title: Poor indoor photo quality
Reviews.Author: Linda L. "Linda L."
Reviews.Content: The quality of the photos this camera takes indoors is poor.  The photos have a yellow or brown tint, and tend to be blurry.  Maybe this one has something wrong with it--but it definitely did not fulfill expectations.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Crystal Jacks
Reviews.Content: I totally recommend this camera to anybody looking into buying a digital camera.  I had previously purchased a Kodak digital camera and a $10 digital camera given to me and they were so difficult to function to the point where I could not get a decent picture to come from them.  I was a little apprehensive from some reviews telling me that this camera should not be used until you had read the manual front to back.  I am not technologically savvy at all and I was working the camera and taking beautiful pictures without barely reading the manual the day I got this beautiful camera in the mail.  The night time pictures appear as if I had taken them on the brightest summer day of the year.  Just Beautiful. I'm glad I hadn't opted to just choose a random camera off the walmart shelf because I am a very impatient person, this camera was sooooo worth the wait.  I hope you love it as much as I do.

Reviews.Title: Great Pix for the Price!
Reviews.Author: Working Mom "Working Mom"
Reviews.Content: Great things about CoolPix:+ Long-lasting battery+ Clear, High Quality pictures+ Adjusts to almost any conditions+ Design and color very stylish+ Well made+ Light weightOther notes:+ Little zooming while taking a video, I think it should be possible to zoom more+ It takes a little bit too long to snap a photo+ Zoom can be difficult to controlAccessories to buy:+ SD card+ Case+ Lens Protector+ Extra batteryI am very pleased with this camera, especially because you get a good product for a good price. It is very well designed, and it fits everywhere.

Reviews.Title: Great Camara for the Price - Best in Class - Awesome ISO & Zoom
Reviews.Author: David Senior
Reviews.Content: Great Camara for the Price - Best in Class - Awesome ISO & Zoom.I did a good comparison with the leading brands. Comparing ISO, Megapixel, Featuers like Image Stabilizer, Face Detection, shutter speed, Optical zoom and others. This camara came up ahead and cheaper than other brands.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted in a compact
Reviews.Author: M. Payne
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my Coolpix L4 which was not too good at low light photos. The S630 is just the opposite. In addition to all the cool features (scene modes, sports continuous, huge zoom, etc), it works great in low light. I took it on vacation and after some 600 shots I used the flash about 10 times. Took great photos from landscapes (the landscape and panorama assist scene modes are nice), night skylines and city streets, to pictures inside a cave (this was tricky, but doable especially with the d-lighting and quick retouch options in playback). The negative reviews talk about noise or blurry photos. Not my camera. For its relative small sensor size I'd understand some noise, but my photos were almost entirely noise free. If you leave every setting in auto, yes it will be tough to get a good shot in low light or full zoom because this camera simply doesn't know what to do half the time. Once you get familiar with the settings (which are quick and simple to change) there's no scene this camera can't capture.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Trevor M. Thomas
Reviews.Content: I have big DSLR Nikons and I end up using the small one most of the time and love itIt allows me to get shots I cant with the DSLR,I think its a great camera for the money and is nice to work with.Maby it isn't as sharp on prints over 8X10, but it's great at 6X4 and that is mostly what I print.Very pleased with this camera.TMT

Reviews.Title: It's okay, but pricy for the quality
Reviews.Author: Giovanni Sesso "Giovanni Sesso"
Reviews.Content: Not too happy with the quality of photo's. The "demo" photo that was posted with the camera does not resemble the quality this camera really takes. Frankly, I'm not sure what camera shot the "little girls in a ball-cage"; but it had to be something with 15X plus pixel ratio.It's okay, but pricy for the quality.

Reviews.Title: Blurry Pictures
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: Had this camera for about 3 weeks, took in on vacation to NY City. About 1/4 of the pictures came out very blurry.  We were a bit disappointed.  We were careful to allow it to properly focus but still some pictures were just not good.The camera looks and feels great though!So we returned it for a slightly more expensive, more bulky Canon SX200IS.  The Canon has yet to take a bad picture so it wasn't user error with the Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S630
Reviews.Author: Rosemarie Matranga
Reviews.Content: This is a great product! The picture quality is wonderful, and the camera is easy to use.  The camera offers many features that allow for great pictures no matter where you are and no matter the weather conditions.  I have had many cameras and so far this one is my favorite!

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpix S630
Reviews.Author: D. K. Pollard DDS
Reviews.Content: The Nikon S630 is for my wife and she likes a camera that is easy to use and takes good pictures and she can carry it in her purse.  This camera fits nicely and she can use it anywhere.

Reviews.Title: review
Reviews.Author: Dale L. Burks
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with my new camera (Nikon s630).  It is easy to use, the screen is very sharp which is good with no viewfinder.  Because of the size I carry it in my front pocket and have taken shots that would have been missed were it larger.  An excellent product as usual from Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix S630
Reviews.Author: B. A. Lauten
Reviews.Content: Still learning, but basic first impression is #1 - this Ruby Red camera is not red at all!  More of a pink/fuchsia.  Would have sent it back for a different color beings I'm not a fan of pink, but I needed it days after its arrival.  #2 - covers for USB cable and card/battery seem low quality, hope they don't break off!  But zoom is great!

Reviews.Title: Great Looking Camera That Takes Horrible Photos
Reviews.Author: Laura M. Wackerly
Reviews.Content: It doesn't take much to make me a happy picture-taker.  I want to point the camera, shoot the photo, and have a great-looking picture to add to my collection.  This is not the camera for that.  I have had it for about a month, and every time I've used it, I've just been frustrated.  I have been a lifelong Kodak EasyShare Digital camera user, but I thought since Nikon had such a great reputation, I'd spend a little more to get a really nice point and shoot.  Wrong.  The camera LOOKS great.  It has lots of cool features that are easy to use.  But the long and the short of it is that, under even normal lighting and action circumstances, this camera cannot take a clear shot.  This morning was the last straw.  I took about 20 photos of my kids playing in my living room, and 8 - EIGHT- of them were keepers, and even a few of those weren't as sharp as they should've been.  I just finished the return authorization process with Amazon, and I'm on my way to buy a Kodak.  Save yourself some grief and skip buying this camera.

Reviews.Title: SMILE
Reviews.Author: A fair judge
Reviews.Content: Briefly I like the camera and all its functions except for one, the battery.  With this particular camera you always have to remember to charge it and if you are out having fun taking pictures and the battery dies you had better purchased one of Nikon's back up batteries.  Personally I like the batteries you can get at any drug store while on vacationing almost anywhere.  I just find that if only they had made there little Nikon camera with normal batteries then and only then would this get a five star rating from me.  Convenience is key.  Sorry Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Frustrated by photo quality
Reviews.Author: Busy NY Mom
Reviews.Content: Although in theory this camera comes with some great features, I am very disappointed. I had a Coolpix 4800 for several years, and despite the fact that it boasted only 4 MP, i feel that the photos were far superior to the ones i am getting out of the s630. I was excited to find another nikon with a lot of zoom, and expected the same quality as what i had previously. Unfortunatly, i was dissapointed.Outdoors the colors are great and crisp, but i have yet to shoot an indoor shot that makes me really happy. as a mom taking pics of her kids all the time, this is frustrating beyond words. the colors take on an unnatural reddish orangey hue, and i constantly get blurring, even with image stabilization. I have tried Auto mode and scene selecter and every type of scene possible, but no matter what i do, the color quality is just off and fuzziness common. After several months i finally figured out that the best way to get my kids and not worry about them moving and therefore blurring or getting that ghostly motions quality, as they invariably do, is to use sports mode, but then the camera drops to 3MP. As a result the photos are not really crisp, which when buying a camera with as many MP as this one has regularly, it's once again, frustrating. On the plus side, I have the red one, which is really fun looking, and i love the size and the zoom is pretty close to my old 4800 (which drowned last summer :-( and is no longer working). Also, it's really comfortable in a hand of my size and has a nice thumbgrip intentation.**Update: After writing this review i realized how truly annoyed i am about my photos, so i actually contacted Nikon through their website and attached two of my photos as examples of their poor quality.  They actually told me what to change in my setting to hopefully fix the problem.  I shot a few pictures which actually seem much better, but it's too soon to tell.  I will be taking lots of pictures in the days to come and if i see a difference, i will come back, change the rating and let you know how to adjust the menu for better pics!*****update 12/29/10 while nikon was very helpful in terms of customer service, the photos are still not as good as they should be.  THe colors are still not true to life and i still get considerable blurring, perhaps not as much as previously, but still a lot.***

Reviews.Title: My opinion - Nikon Coolpix S630--any suggestions ??
Reviews.Author: Roy Stauffer "Hollywood_53"
Reviews.Content: The Nikon Coolpix S-630 , takes great outdoor Portrait or Landscape picturesOn the other hand ; having much difficulty getting a good quality indoor picture under almost any lighting situation... flash or no flashin these situations the pics. come out very yellow and fuzzyAlso wondering if other owner users are hearing the same ratcheting noise while the camera trys to focus.I have read the manuel & tryed the many settings options -still a disappointment in picture quality !Really like to hear any feedback from other owners on this issue !  Ive had H/P & Kodak low cost point & shoot cameras, much older products that took much better all around pics w/such ease of operation !Expected much more from the Nikon.

Reviews.Title: satisfactory
Reviews.Author: GyanSingh Dang
Reviews.Content: in the beginning i was not happy with the product, but as i got friendly with its settings and the technics to use it,,, then i found it as an awesome camera.... i recommend this camera...

Reviews.Title: GREAT LITTLE CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Judy Conley "JUDY CONLEY"
Reviews.Content: i BOUGHT THIS CAMERA FOR MY GRANDDAUGHTER, SHE SAID IT WAS THE BEST CAMERA EVER, THEN HER MOTHER NEEDED A CAMERA FOR HER WORK, HERS HAD DIED AND ALL OF A SUDDEN MY GRANDDAUGHTER'S CAMERA WAS GONE.  MY GRANDDAUGHTER AND HER BROTHER DECIDED TO BUY ONE FOR THEIR MOTHER.  MY CAMERA DIED AND SINCE EVERYONE LOVES THIS CAMERA I BOUGHT ONE FOR MYSELF.  IT DOES EVERYTHING I NEED AND DOES IT SO SIMPLY.

Reviews.Title: A nice compact camera
Reviews.Author: Vitoria S. A. Silva "Vivica"
Reviews.Content: It was all I needed. But if you have a little more money to spend, I'd recommend one with HD shooting video. But I LOVE this camera. High and low iso and perfect automatic pictures. Also Smile Shutter and sports shooting mode.

Reviews.Title: great camera - great price
Reviews.Author: Liz Pond "kayaker"
Reviews.Content: We had bought this camera somewhere else at Christmas, we love it and out daughter really loved it. We bought hers at Amazon for her birthday and saved more than $30.

Reviews.Title: s630 a great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: J. F. Buckley "buckstar58"
Reviews.Content: I discovered that the S630 is a great camera for astro imageing. The 16 frame shooting then ato stacking was a unexpected feature. My $1100 worth of Rebel xti wont do that. Nikon should get this camera out to the astronmy world. The S630 is a very easy to use camera and has many good things to keep a beginer or a old timer in pictures of pro quality

Reviews.Title: Great Action Shots!
Reviews.Author: K. Luciano
Reviews.Content: We have 2 Labrador Retrievers that compete in the sport of Dock Diving.  With the multi-frame feature of this Nikon S630, we are able to capture incredible & progressive mid air jumps with no blur.  Although the quality of pixels drops when using this mode, it still provides a very good quality photograph.  For the price, you simply can't beat it.  This camera is easy to use, light weight and has some really great features.  I love it!

Reviews.Title: Concerns with the packaged offering
Reviews.Author: J. W. Wagner "Jack"
Reviews.Content: There is an error in the "packaged offering" with the Nikon and the extra battery.This is what is stated:Best Value  Buy Nikon Coolpix S630 12MP Digital Camera with 7x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 2.7 inch LCD (Jet Black) and get Targus Digital TGB-ENEL10 LION Replacement Battery for Nikon ENEL10 at an additional 25% off Amazon.com's everyday low price.  +Buy Together Today: To see our price, add these items to your cart. Why don't we show the price?This is the wrong battery for this camera.  It should be the ENEL12!The camera is outstanding!!!  It is just an error in the grouping that is a problem.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Camera
Reviews.Author: Ms. Margaret Wickham
Reviews.Content: I bought this for myself for Christmas.  So far, it has been very easy to operate, and the photo quality is very good.  I have already recommended this camera to several people.

Reviews.Title: It Took Blurry Pictures
Reviews.Author: S. Swisher "SamTaxMan"
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera to my 27 year old daughter for Christmas as she wanted a zoom which was 7x optical.  She started using it and the pictures were coming out blurry.  She went online to a camera bulletin board and found out that other owners had the same problem with it.  I returned it.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: D. Campbell "Daccer"
Reviews.Content: Got this camera for Christmas and really enjoy it.The major things that I appreciate about the camera to date are:  Simplicity of use - timed pictures, macro function, scene selection  Quality - had a 4M camera previously; 12M makes all the difference when you want  to zoom and crop  Size - lightweight and small enough for your shirt or pants pocket.Where improvements could be made is in the uploading of pictures interface and charging. With what comes in the package from Nikon, you have to take out the battery to charge it.  My former Fuji camera (F401) came with a nice docking station.  That would be nice.  A combination docking station for uploading pics along with charging station is a very nice convenient feature.  The USB data cable plug is pretty difficult to get to and connect to as it has a cover over it which is not easy to move out of the way.Overall, a very good camera...with good quality...but I'm only into it about 3 weeks now so.  And, I'd be remiss if I didn't say, purchased at Amazon for $189 and delivered promptly as always.  Very pleased with all of my Amazon purchases.

Reviews.Title: Picture quality is really Good
Reviews.Author: Praveen Dodda
Reviews.Content: The Picture quality of this camera is really goodReal good product for real good price

Reviews.Title: Cool Camera - but poor picture quality
Reviews.Author: PhotoHobby
Reviews.Content: I purchase this camera a few weeks back and I was very excited about it.  I was looking forward to the quality of Nikon lens, the size and weight of the camera.  Now that I have received it and took a couple of pictures with this camera, I am very disappointed with the performance on the picture quality of this camera.  Maybe because this camera is so advance that I do not how to manipulate the settings in order to take a shot; but overall the quality does not even come close to my Canon SD970IS.  I have taken in to the Nikon shop and all they did was to check it to specification.  That means, it is design as it.  As to the picture, you have to make sure you have plenty of lighting and not much variation with it as it does not give you much option to change the settings.  This camera does have a lot of automatic features, like scene selections, auto focus, and image stabilization; however, there is no way that I know of how to manually set the F-stops.  I try a close up picture with limited lighting but turning on the flash, you would think it would capture the image but maybe an over expose area where the flash had taken placed.  Instead, I capture the picture with a lot of other spots to illustrate that I was underexposed, even when I had the flash.Bottom line, if I could return this camera, I would and stay with Canon.

Reviews.Title: V Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Atalinder S. Bindra
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice camera.Its small, light and takes good pictures.I love it.It has soo many features in it.I would say, if you want a camera just take this model.

Reviews.Title: Autofocus breaks after 7 months
Reviews.Author: Sue "The Alchemist"
Reviews.Content: After 7 months of light use, my Coolpix S630 has died. I noticed a constant whirring noise when I turned it on. I then noticed that the focus on the screen was going in-out-in-out etc. I called Nikon and their tech support said that I needed to send it in for repairs. When I tried to find out if this was covered under warrenty, they told me that I would have to pay for any repairs.If Nikon will not fix a camera that does even last 1 year, then I am done with Nikon.

Reviews.Title: HUGE Disappointment!
Reviews.Author: T. Davy
Reviews.Content: This camera was a huge disappointment to me. It is the second Nikon digital point and shoot I have owned. The first was several years ago and was a good camera. I also own Sony and Canon digital point and shoots and a Panasonic digital mega-zoom. This camera appears to be a cheap imitation of the Sony Cybershot line. It is set up almost identically. The camera feels OK as far as quality, but no match for any of the others I own. Most importantly, the image quality is absolute CRAP! Once in a while it manages to take a good picture, only then in good light, and only if I take 3 or 4 shots and hope one will turn out OK. Too much light and the image will be washed out. The flash is way too powerful & washes out low light shots. If no flash is used in low light the images are terrible as well. Any zoom over 3x is worthless as well since the shot will not be in focus. Worst of all: I bought this as a gift for my wife for Christmas and expected it would be better than our Sony, which was great, but broken by our little boy. The feeling of giving a bad gift has definitely sworn me off Nikons for good. My wife has no patience for technology that is not easy to use without endless donking with the settings. Sony, Canon or Panasonic are the way to go. Do NOT buy this camera if you are looking for something that will take great pictures every time.

Reviews.Title: You can do better for the money.
Reviews.Author: Paul Bender
Reviews.Content: For me, the real selling points of this camera were: its size, its outstanding zoom range, and the fact that it is a Nikon. The camera is an ideal size, and conforms well to the hands when shooting. The user interface is not entirely intuitive, but if you spend a little time with the camera, it is not very difficult to figure out. The zoom range is fantastic. But the motor used to control the zoom won't let you continuously zoom in and out; it is set to allow you to only zoom to a certain number of discrete positions. I found this to be really annoying--frequently, I wanted to zoom in or out just a tiny bit, but the darn thing would jump to its next zoom zone, which would be way off-the-mark.If you are looking for a point-and-shoot camera that works very well in fully auto mode, then this is NOT the camera for you. Virtually all of the fully-automatic shots I took with this camera, particularly indoors, came out poorly exposed--typically out-of-focus, blurred, with inaccurate color rendering, or with noticeable digital noise. I found that if I took the time to go to the menu and select the proper shooting mode (for example, "Indoor Portrait," "Still Life," etc) to conform to the shooting environment at the time, the results were much better, though still frequently flawed.  If you are buying a point-and-shoot camera in order to actually point-and-shoot, I would argue that users generally don't expect to have to reset modes for every situation in order to get a decent shot.  (I own a 6 year old Kodak 3.1MP camera that, hands down, takes way better point-and-shoot auto-exposed photos than the Nikon S630. Unfortunately, the Kodak is fairly bulky and its viewing LCD, by today's standards especially, is very tiny--which is why am I looking to supplement it with a newer camera.)It turns out that a cousin of mine bought the same camera at about the same time, and she experienced similar results, and returned the camera. I am going to do the same thing. For me, it was unfortunately not the right choice.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S630
Reviews.Author: Linda newcomer
Reviews.Content: This camera is light weight ,easy to use and takes great pictures It holds a charge for a LONG time. The charger comes with it.Couldn't be happier!!

Reviews.Title: A good replacement
Reviews.Author: ishant44
Reviews.Content: This was a replacement for a coolpix elf . It a gift and the new owner of this camera loves it ,  The size is a little bigger than the elf but the performance far out weighs that

Reviews.Title: Feedback
Reviews.Author: Strayer University Book Seller
Reviews.Content: In very good condition. The camera itself is good in terms of convenience and functionality. Here we go - good stuff.

Reviews.Title: great camera, durable
Reviews.Author: takestoomanypictures
Reviews.Content: I don't. Usually write reviews but this camera deserves one. Wasn't thrilled with it at first, but after playing with some settings it take awesome pictures. I also have a Nikon D60 to compare it to. But, the reason this camera deserves a good review is because of its durability after a photo shoot with my kids, my camera accidentally got left outside, in the rain. MY neighbor brought it to me 4 days later. I was sure it wAs ruined, but i turned it on anyway. It worked! The screen had a ton of moisture behind it and the lenses too. I took the battery out while it was on so the lenses would stay out, then i took the card out too and left it sit for a few days. I put it all back together today and it works like New!

Reviews.Title: Got this for my wife
Reviews.Author: Hibby
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my wife. She seemed to love until it quit working (mind you after she dropped it). But she loved the picture quality and zoom. She wants something a little bigger, but bragged about this camera, while it worked.

Reviews.Title: Wow Wow Wow
Reviews.Author: Balaji Rajagopal
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera with a lot of good features, eas and handy. Can be very reliable. I love this one for sure.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S630
Reviews.Author: NormaLee
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a little camera for those times when I didn't want to carry my Nikon SLR.  I was with a friend who was taking photos in a dark restaurant of her daughter's birthday party and the photos looked fantastic.  I asked what camera she was using and it was the Coolpix S630.  I believe the camera is discontinued now, but I found it on Amazon at one of their sellers and I have been very happy with it.  What I don't like about most of the newer model point and shoots is there are TOO many features -- confusing, and not necessary.  All I'm looking for is a camera that takes good pictures.  I've tried others and liked them, but then when I see the quality of the photos I am disappointed.  The Nikon S630 takes great photos without any fussing.  Not sure why, but Nikon cameras really capture color well and the S630 is no exception -- the photos I've taken with this camera are beautiful, sharp, and easy to get.  While the camera gives you plenty of "scene" options, including fireworks and sunset, the normal mode is great at automatically choosing what settings to use for the scene.  All the buttons to change scenes or settings (if you feel the need) are right there on the back panel -- no searching around for them.  Very user friendly!  Another plus is the rechargeable (charger is included) Lithium Ion battery that comes with the camera.  These batteries last so much longer than AA batteries!  Though the "movie" option is not something I use very often, I tried it and it does a good job.  Adjusts for different lighting well, and picks up sound very well.  I will be surprised if you don't love the Nikon Coolpix S630 and the photos you can take with it.

Reviews.Title: Not so Ruby Red
Reviews.Author: Lee721
Reviews.Content: The camera itself is great! I have the same one in Black. I bought the Red one for my Finace'. He said the color gears more towards pink. I have since bought him the Blue one.So just note, if buying and you're a male or buying for a male...it might seem pinkish.

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera!
Reviews.Author: Scrpbooklady
Reviews.Content: After purchasing my DSLR 3 years ago, I had given my other camera to my daughter so have not had a small point and shoot.  I broke my shoulder last year and as a result using my DSLR for extended periods of time has become difficult.  When our family was planning our family trip to Disney, I was concerned about being able to carry and use the DSLR day after day so I was looking around for a point and shoot that would still give me high resolution pictures and that had a good zoom lens.  I have had excellent results with the Nikon Coolpix series through the years so my first choice was this camera.  Before purchasing from Amazon, I went to local stores and did some hands on comparison shopping - comparing how the camera felt in hand, quality of construction, and response times.  This camera impressed me on all of the above.  The only concern I found (and which I had read in other reviews) is that the zoom is somewhat difficult to control.  Once you get used to it, it's not horrible but it is one drawback to this otherwise excellent point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Enjoy this camera
Reviews.Author: tree08
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera about three months now and I like the pictures and videos it takes.  I bought a larger storage card and put five days worth of a mix of pictures and videos while on a trip this month. The panorama shots are great looking. This is my second Nikon Coolpix (brought one over five years ago) and Nikon has not disappointed me.

Reviews.Title: Cool Pix
Reviews.Author: Sandra Krooswyk
Reviews.Content: Easy to use ! Great pictures. Not SOOO expensive that I have to fret about it.

Reviews.Title: GOOD PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: K V RAO
Reviews.Content: ITS REALLY GOOD TO EASY USE, BATTERY LIFE IS REALLY GOOD FOR LONG SHOT,GOOD PRODUCT FOR BEST PRICE.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the money
Reviews.Author: Thomas K Henderson
Reviews.Content: I was pleased by the rapid delivery from the source, and everything that was supposed to be in the package was there.  I was disappointed that the extra memory device was not included, but the advertizement didn't say it would have one.  I found out later, I could have gotten camera, case and memory card at Costco for a few dollars more, but I am satisfied with what I did buy.

Reviews.Title: A P&S; with 7x zoom
Reviews.Author: JJ "DIY"
Reviews.Content: I got this Nikon S630 today and tried it right away in my backyard where I always tested my new cameras. This is a first refurbished camera that I bought because of its good price and the 7x zoom. Basing on the reviews, I think I got a good refurbished camera, not defective or abused. The image quality of this 12MP Nikon is not as sharp as my SD1100 and F40fd that has only 8MP, but I do like its style and the 7x zoom. Its pictures are usable but it could be hard to get any photo that will surprise you. Some of the pictures from the two 8mp cameras were really amazing. I have not tried the low-light photo yet, but do not expect it to be any better.Update:After using it for two weeks, I decided to add one more star for its 7x zoom and PQ with manual settings. I found its PQ was improved, to my taste, by changing some of the default settings.1. Limit the ISO to fixed range2. Use manual 2-stage focus3. Choose vivid colorThe biggest problem of this camera is the speed. It's not a fast camera, so it's not easy to catch any moving target. The image stablizer is not as good as Canon's.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Winglady
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in November of 2009 while on vacation in Oregon.  I was replacing a Sony DSC10, that badly needed retirement.  This camera I bought because my Dad had one and loved his photos.  I did a little more research and decided to get one for myself.  I have taken hundreds of photos with it since then.  Like all point and shoots it has it's limitations.  In really dislike the flimsly USB cover.  I just know that is going to break soon.  The picture quality is very good.  Nothing to compare to my SLR though.  Overall, for the price, it's not a bad camera.  I don't have lug my big SLR along, and this camera does a decent job with a lot of features to boot. I would recommend it to someone who wanted a quality camera with a low price tag.

Reviews.Title: Love my coolpix
Reviews.Author: Renee Colgate- Walcom "Renee Walcom"
Reviews.Content: I love my coolpix. I think it takes great pictures, is easy to use and is so portable.  I also purchased a Coolpix for a friend and she had nothing but great things to say about it. I have read reviews about blurry pictures, but this has not been a problem for me. I would recommend the coolpix, I couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Frustrated by photo quality
Reviews.Author: Busy NY Mom
Reviews.Content: Although in theory this camera comes with some great features, I am very disappointed. I had a Coolpix 4800 for several years, and despite the fact that it boasted only 4 MP, i feel that the photos were far superior to the ones i am getting out of the s630. I was excited to find another nikon with a lot of zoom, and expected the same quality as what i had previously. Unfortunatly, i was dissapointed.Outdoors the colors are great and crisp, but i have yet to shoot an indoor shot that makes me really happy. as a mom taking pics of her kids all the time, this is frustrating beyond words. the colors take on an unnatural reddish orangey hue, and i constantly get blurring, even with image stabilization. I have tried Auto mode and scene selecter and every type of scene possible, but no matter what i do, the color quality is just off and fuzziness common. After several months i finally figured out that the best way to get my kids and not worry about them moving and therefore blurring or getting that ghostly motions quality, as they invariably do, is to use sports mode, but then the camera drops to 3MP. As a result the photos are not really crisp, which when buying a camera with as many MP as this one has regularly, it's once again, frustrating. On the plus side, I have the red one, which is really fun looking, and i love the size and the zoom is pretty close to my old 4800 (which drowned last summer :-( and is no longer working). Also, it's really comfortable in a hand of my size and has a nice thumbgrip intentation.**Update: After writing this review i realized how truly annoyed i am about my photos, so i actually contacted Nikon through their website and attached two of my photos as examples of their poor quality.  They actually told me what to change in my setting to hopefully fix the problem.  I shot a few pictures which actually seem much better, but it's too soon to tell.  I will be taking lots of pictures in the days to come and if i see a difference, i will come back, change the rating and let you know how to adjust the menu for better pics!*****update 12/29/10 while nikon was very helpful in terms of customer service, the photos are still not as good as they should be. THe colors are still not true to life and i still get considerable blurring, perhaps not as much as previously, but still a lot.***

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: E. ROWNEY
Reviews.Content: On my way home from work a month ago, I pulled off the road and hiked for a few hours my second hour in to my hike. I came across two Red Fox pups.  I took over 30 pictures and and video maybe an hour and a half worth.  Unfortionatly I didnt have my tripod with me so most of the pictures I took are a little blury.  On that hike I crossed at least to sreams on downed tree's.  The camera being light and not bulky helps plus if I dropped it in either one of the streams I would only been out $300.00 instead of dropping the expensive nikon d5000.

Reviews.Title: Quick and easy
Reviews.Author: Jamie Kreiman
Reviews.Content: Great little camera, and affordable price.  Easy to inadvertantly switch off flash.  Pay attention so you can tell if it happens. Camera shoots in low light, without flash.

Reviews.Title: Can't take pictures of anything purple - good camera otherwise
Reviews.Author: D. Smith "YarnIt Lady"
Reviews.Content: This is a good little camera for quick trips to family outings or sites where you don't want to lugg a big camera along. The main problem I have with this camera is it doesn't pick up purple hues and captures them as blue. I bought the camera to take pictures of my projects and to post on my website but now I have to figure out another camera to purchase that will capture purples since that is one of my most popular selling colors. USB port door is a little flimsy and the zoom is a little too fast. Overall this is a good camera for someone that is looking for something to take casual pictures and isn't too serious about the picture quality.

Reviews.Title: My favorite pocket camera
Reviews.Author: trlamb
Reviews.Content: As much as I like my digital SLR, it's just too bulky to carry everywhere. So I tried to find an almost-as-good pocket camera. The Nikon S630 is the third digital pocket camera I've owned and definitely my favorite. I've been using it for about one year.The optics are very good, the menu is easy to use, and there are a sufficient number of program settings available. I have successfully cropped images into very nice photos. I usually print only 4x6 from this camera so I haven't really tested the image quality. There's a tiny bit of shutter delay which makes taking photos of active young kids a challenge. But the auto-focus is way faster than the older digital cameras. The museum, dusk/dawn and sunset settings have produced some impressive results.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Gina Osborn
Reviews.Content: I don't like the way the little door is designed on the side to download pictures it's tricky & makes you feel like your gonna break the little door. Sometimes you have to hold down the button to get the picture instead of push an click.

Reviews.Title: Great cam for the price
Reviews.Author: Rowen Matthew Gunn "zenithangunn"
Reviews.Content: Pleased with the pics, still a little blurry/grainy at full resolutions but sized down they look great. It's a touch to big to be a real pocket cam, it's about the size of two blackberry phones stacked on top of each other. Highly recommend some sort of screen protector for the screen. It's fast and responsive, A LOT of scene options.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas E. Hines
Reviews.Content: Great camera for a gift. Easy to use and picture quality is good. Put in your pocket and go.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera for price & size
Reviews.Author: Jacquelyne L. Adams
Reviews.Content: So far I am very impressed with this camera.  It has a good solid feel and is comfortable to hold. To me it is VERY fast to start up and take pictures.  I"m only just learning all the features, there a TONS!  I"m very pleased with this NIkon S630 and already feel it is WELL worth the approx $200 price.

Reviews.Title: cool pix
Reviews.Author: Thomas A. Sample
Reviews.Content: The camera gave us the capabilities that we wanted. Quick pictures , great quality, and east to use. Thanks Tom Sample

Reviews.Title: Great Camera at a Fair Price
Reviews.Author: sin257
Reviews.Content: I have only been using this camera for about a month now, but I really like it. I especially like the anti-vibration and facial recognition features. You can really tell the difference in the auto-focus when these features are enable.The only con I see with this camera is the awkward position of the screen and buttons. I have not found a way to comfortably take pictures with one hand. I have to hold the camera by the top and bottom edges. I would have to get fingerprints all over the screen to hold it with one hand. However, I expect this from a such a compact camera. More room would mean a larger size.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera, very pleased
Reviews.Author: Darren A. Dieguez "Darren"
Reviews.Content: Thank you for sending me (quickly) what is a high quality, sharp definition, easily workable camera. I've already used it to take some photos of friends and family merriment which turned out very well. It was a good use of my money. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: Nikon
Reviews.Author: GIE
Reviews.Content: The camera is good for easy use; it's compact for easy carrying; and takes good pictures.

Reviews.Title: My Daughter loves this camera
Reviews.Author: Joe D. Harris
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas present for my 21 year old daughter.  She loves it.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: D. Scheckler
Reviews.Content: This camera takes beautiful pictures. I previously had a Kodak and was very disappointed. This is a winner.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!
Reviews.Author: R. N. Steppe "RachNichole"
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this camera! I love to take photos of my dogs while they are playing and have had no trouble catching those special, action packed memories with my new Nikon! It's very easy to use, has various settings for different scenes, and takes very crisp pictures! The best part is that you can zoom and crop the pictures from the camera itself and save the cropped picture to the camera to easily print!

Reviews.Title: great Camera
Reviews.Author: Pamela G. Pope
Reviews.Content: The shipping was fast and the cost for the camera was better than I could find anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly surprised
Reviews.Author: Emily Warren
Reviews.Content: Not only is this camera beautiful and easy to carry around, but the picture quality is outstanding. I wanted to shell out the extra bucks to get a 7x optical zoom instead of the 3x and I am so happy that I did. This is a great camera and such a cute color! :)

Reviews.Title: Good choice
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Watkins "Watkins"
Reviews.Content: Camera is simple to use both for stills and video and produces sharp images. A good gift for someone wanting to take family photos without mastering the ins and outs of more complex digital slrs.

Reviews.Title: no view finder
Reviews.Author: S. Wedel
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because a friend recommended it but I'm dissapointed it doesn't have a viewfinder so that when I'm photographing outside the glare on the screen is too much and not visible.  I also thought the the large number of megapixels would make for a clearer picture but not the case.

Reviews.Title: Nikon CoolPix-Jetblack Digital Camera, Versatile and Small,Cool
Reviews.Author: Jose Lopez "Jose Lopez"
Reviews.Content: Got this little Black Nikon Coolpix @ best buy for $100something+ ..under $200. Not bad, can take moving shots of a Car, sometimes though it's pain to find the right adjustment so you won't get a gloomy pic. has cool features, a definite upgrade over my 6year old but still working big Sony Cybershot(was considered small then!) which kills batteries very fast, this one doesn't need batteries, has it's own Nikon Battery you could charge.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality... but....
Reviews.Author: Devan Sizemore "Super Serious Reviewer 5000"
Reviews.Content: 7x Zoom is nice, but I really wish P&S; cameras had better zoom that didn't distort. This was a gift for the girlfriend, she gives it a 5 of 5, but she's being nice i guess (since i bought it for her).Here's what she has told me about it:Great for:The Zoo, concerts (only if you're on the rail), Home and pets, Gardens, detailed close ups, easy to use, big display for photo review.Not so great for:When you're pretty far from something, dark-photo quality (night time, clubs, etc), presets are stupid sometimes.Guess she's gonna get a SLR for X-mas, better start saving up!Great P&S; camera hands down, just needs a bit more zoom =/

Reviews.Title: lousy durability
Reviews.Author: DrSam
Reviews.Content: The LCD cracked on the inside while the camera was in my briefcase with my net book and Blackberry, neither of which show any ill effects. There was no abuse or mishandling what so ever. Nikon will not replace the LCD under warranty. If this camera had reasonable durability it would be worth the $200 I initially paid for it, but as it failed under gentle handling and its true cost is now over $300, I advise that no one purchase this camera---or for that matter purchase anything from Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures!
Reviews.Author: C. Houston
Reviews.Content: I would love a little more zoom but overall this camera is great.  The pictures come out beautifully clear and it captures the colors brilliantly.  I had been using a very old, very worn out camera before so this is a breath of fresh air!  Great deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT, LOVE IT, LOVE it
Reviews.Author: Debra Armstrong
Reviews.Content: It's light weight and easy to use (with a brief skim through the directions)!  Takes great pix.  No excuse for not getting "the shot" anymore.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix S630
Reviews.Author: Liam Gray
Reviews.Content: Nikon Coolpix S630 12MP Digital Camera with 7x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 2.7 inch LCD (Jet Black)Wonderful little point-and-shoot camera.  With 12 megapixel resolution and 7x optical zoom, its a versatile device with a large display.  There are a number of different features: camera mode, numerous scene modes, and movie mode.  Fits in a shirt pocket, so its easy to carry.  Nikon quality at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: J. Karasek
Reviews.Content: I won the Nikon S630 in a drawing in 2009.  This was a fairly top-of-the-line camera back then, and I was excited.  I'm very glad I didn't pay for it.  Blurry, grainy pictures are the norm with this one.  Don't even think about using indoors.  LCD screen tricks you into thinking you've got some good pictures.  Once you pull them up on a computer, the truth hits you and you realize those moments you captured are garbage.  Auto or manual, doesn't matter what settings you use.  Maybe this one is a dud, but I see similar comments in other reviews.  Sold it on craigslist for some peanuts.  I'm glad it is out of the house.  Hopefully the new Nikons in this category are better, but I've had good luck with Canon and I'm going to stick with them for a while.

Reviews.Title: Piece of crap. Shame on Nikon.
Reviews.Author: Paul Sonderman
Reviews.Content: I've owned an used Nikon cameras and lenses for decades, both consumer and professional models. This camera is an embarrassment to Nikon's name. Its Vietnamese build quality is mediocre, its battery like sucks and it doesn't turn itself off to preserve a charge. Its display--rendered useless in sunlight--is not backed up by any viewfinder. Its controls/menus are difficult to use, its auto focus is undependable. In short, bar none, the Nikon CoolPix S630 is one of the worst automatic cameras I've ever owned. When it comes to this level of point and shoot digital cameras, stick with Canon.

Reviews.Title: not so good
Reviews.Author: Pawel A. Lach "paul"
Reviews.Content: I thought it will have better picture quality, after reading so many reviews. It has nice shape, pretty cool futures but a quality of picture is really bad comparing to my older model of canon this is why I was shocked. I regret buying it. Next time I will stick with canon. Also, my friends bought it, and at first I was thinking maybe the weather was bad or sth but pictures do come out a bit greyish and foggy at times.

Reviews.Title: DURABILITY VERY LOW-CUSTOMER SUPPORT NON EXISTENT
Reviews.Author: DrSam
Reviews.Content: The LCD cracked on the inside while the camera was in my briefcase with my net book and Blackberry, neither of which show any ill effects.  There was no abuse or mishandling what so ever.  Nikon will not replace the LCD under warranty.  If this camera had reasonable durability it would be worth the $200 I initially paid for it, but as it failed under gentle handling and its true cost is now over $300, I advise that no one purchase this camera---or for that matter purchase anything from Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Frustrated by photo quality
Reviews.Author: Busy NY Mom
Reviews.Content: Although in theory this camera comes with some great features, I am very disappointed. I had a Coolpix 4800 for several years, and despite the fact that it boasted only 4 MP, i feel that the photos were far superior to the ones i am getting out of the s630. I was excited to find another nikon with a lot of zoom, and expected the same quality as what i had previously. Unfortunatly, i was dissapointed.Outdoors the colors are great and crisp, but i have yet to shoot an indoor shot that makes me really happy. as a mom taking pics of her kids all the time, this is frustrating beyond words. the colors take on an unnatural reddish orangey hue, and i constantly get blurring, even with image stabilization. I have tried Auto mode and scene selecter and every type of scene possible, but no matter what i do, the color quality is just off and fuzziness common. After several months i finally figured out that the best way to get my kids and not worry about them moving and therefore blurring or getting that ghostly motions quality, as they invariably do, is to use sports mode, but then the camera drops to 3MP. As a result the photos are not really crisp, which when buying a camera with as many MP as this one has regularly, it's once again, frustrating. On the plus side, I have the red one, which is really fun looking, and i love the size and the zoom is pretty close to my old 4800 (which drowned last summer :-( and is no longer working). Also, it's really comfortable in a hand of my size and has a nice thumbgrip intentation.**Update: After writing this review i realized how truly annoyed i am about my photos, so i actually contacted Nikon through their website and attached two of my photos as examples of their poor quality.  They actually told me what to change in my setting to hopefully fix the problem.  I shot a few pictures which actually seem much better, but it's too soon to tell.  I will be taking lots of pictures in the days to come and if i see a difference, i will come back, change the rating and let you know how to adjust the menu for better pics!*****update 12/29/10 while nikon was very helpful in terms of customer service, the photos are still not as good as they should be. THe colors are still not true to life and i still get considerable blurring, perhaps not as much as previously, but still a lot.***

Reviews.Title: nikon? i got a dud.
Reviews.Author: oz zy "waiting for the dvd"
Reviews.Content: i selected the highest quality setting, 4000*, yet the pictures were grainy, of probably a 2 mega quality. my optio 4 mega camera did much better. the colors, even in vivid mode, are washed out. very, very, disappointed in this nikon product.

Reviews.Title: extremely pleased
Reviews.Author: Patricia Taylor "Pat Taylor"
Reviews.Content: I am very very happy with this product.  It is easy to operate, it is comfortble to hold, it takes excellent pictures, plus I think  it is a pretty camera.  It has a number of options to choose from. I couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: good value for the price
Reviews.Author: AK
Reviews.Content: This is very good value for the price. I bought this as a present and my friend is very happy with the producr, and i am happy with the price

Reviews.Title: Loving it!
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Reyes
Reviews.Content: Just loving the new Nikon Coolpix S630. Great picture quality. So easy to use when you first get it.

Reviews.Title: coolpix s630
Reviews.Author: Courtney C. Brown
Reviews.Content: the camera does not work! I have tried everything to get it to work but it turns on but doesn't take pictures

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S630 12mp Dig Cam w/7x zoom
Reviews.Author: K. Morgan
Reviews.Content: arrived within 3 days, all in great shape.  So far working great, still learning it.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Kat_F "Kat"
Reviews.Content: Good basic camera, bought it refurbished, so there was NO memory card or case which was very dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: Fun little camera
Reviews.Author: Janette J. Hoffman
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use and great zoom potential and transfer abilities.  It works best when you tilt the picture to give it an artsy flair.It doesn't focus very quickly and consequently I miss some shots and some shots come out blurry.  That is my only criticism.

Reviews.Title: coolpix s630
Reviews.Author: Wayne Valerius
Reviews.Content: Great little camera with very good picture quality--surprised that it comes with only enough memory for 14 pictures.  You must purchase memory cards separately but with only the 4gb card you get over a thousand pictures in memory and you can purchase up to a 16gb one if you wish.  The zoom is very strong and works best if used outside.

Reviews.Title: Would really like to have a dock.
Reviews.Author: MsKentuckyGoldwing
Reviews.Content: ---At this point, I'm still trying to get use to my new camera.  But, it's not as easy as I thoughtit would be.  Without the dock to use when not in use, makes it harder to use continuously.  If it wasn't for the extra battery I bought to go along with it, the evening pictures I took wouldn't have been here from our last camping trip. It's disapointing to have to change batteries every 8 hours when a dock would have kept the camera ready for use for longer time.---It's also disappointing for me to not be able to take more pictures before having to change the battery.  But, for the price I paid, that will have to be something I'll have to get use to. Let me explain!!  When you are riding on a back of a motorcycle, you must have a camera that will react to the movement and the shots that you are taking. Sometimes you will go longer than 8 hours and other times itcould be a 300 mile trip and take more than 220 pictures at a time. But if the battery goes dead before that it's a bit hard to change the battery as you move down the highway.  My other camera I had for 3 years got broke.  Spent money to get it fixed, it came back and was terrible.Don't have any idea what I was doing wrong.  So this was my next choice and it's really going to take patiences to get it to do what I want it to do and when.  When you switch like this from one to another, you will lose something and what I lost was something I came to expect. Which is what I wanted this camera to do.---As for the camera itself, I love it. Traveling as we do, it fits in my hand quite nicely and can take some great shots moving or sitting still.  I can't say that I'm disapoointed in that part of it at all. I don't take pictures of just one thing and it falls right in there with what I'm doing at the time. I'm not a pro, but some of my pictures could be used as such, that I have gotten from this camera. It's light weight and has the settings that are needed to accomplish what ever you are wanting to do.---As for the other - it will take time to get use to and I will conquer that as I go along.  Then, I'll be a happy biker and photgrapher again!!

Reviews.Title: not reliable
Reviews.Author: Jules "Jules"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera a year ago.  I really liked it until the lens stopped working.  I called Nikon and my extended warranty expired less than a month ago.  They were not able to help.  They said they could repair it for $100 plus shipping to and from.  Since I purchased it on sale for $150 I didn't think that the $100 repair was worth it.  So now I have a camera I can't use at all.  I am planning on giving it to my toddler as a toy because that's all it's good for now!  I would expect a product from Nikon to last more than a year.  Very disappointed and I don't think I will choose Nikon again.

Reviews.Title: Great compact camera
Reviews.Author: T. Gordon
Reviews.Content: This Nikon compact works great and has wonderful battery life.The video quality is surprising good.

Reviews.Title: Enh
Reviews.Author: Ms Liz "Ms Liz"
Reviews.Content: I wasted my money on this purchase.  I thought even though my phone has a decent camera, I would like to have a seperate camera.  Well, I was WRONG!  There is no touch screen as the discription has claimed.  The camera does not come with a memory card. A memory card would be an addition $60 - $80.  Boo! It can store up to maybe 20 pictures on the camera itself.  I would definately not buy again.  It's just sitting on my desk collecting dust.

Reviews.Title: coolpix s630
Reviews.Author: Alejandro M. Gomez
Reviews.Content: I loved the color.some pictures come out great.the soom is very important,but i have had pictures with better cuality pictures.some are very blurry.
